alert.note: Alert for Eastern Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 2:10PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marion County through 245 PM EDT... At 209 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pittman, or 8 miles south of Juniper Springs, moving northeast at 10 mph. Another storm is just southeast of Salt Springs drifting northeast. HAZARD...Winds near 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Juniper Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
